content:
Diagnosis:	WHO Grade I subependymoma of fourth ventricle

Management:	15 March 2023 - Subtotal resection
		April-May 2023 - Post-operative radiotherapy 54Gy in 30 fractions

Current Situation:	Routine surveillance

I reviewed [redacted name] in the neuro-oncology follow-up clinic today. She remains clinically stable at 14 months post-completion of treatment. Her main symptoms of headache and dizziness have completely resolved. She reports good energy levels and has returned to work full-time as an accountant. No new neurological symptoms reported.

On examination, she is alert and fully oriented. Cranial nerves intact. No cerebellar signs. Gait normal.

MRI brain performed last week shows stable post-treatment appearances with no evidence of disease progression. The small residual disease remains unchanged in size at 8mm.

Plan is to continue surveillance with next MRI brain in 6 months and clinical review thereafter. Patient understands to contact us sooner if any new symptoms develop.

cancer_timeline.value: MRI brain shows stable post-treatment appearances with residual disease unchanged at 8mm

patient_facts.value: Returned to work full-time as an accountant
Alert and fully oriented, cranial nerves intact, no cerebellar signs, normal gait

status_updates.value: WHO Grade I subependymoma with small stable residual disease following surgery and radiotherapy. Clinically well at 14 months post-treatment with resolution of initial symptoms.
Stable post-treatment appearances on MRI with unchanged 8mm residual disease
